ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to think about political movements like populism in the context of political systems around the world. I learned about the many definitions of populism, in addition to learning about why populism matters.

I learned about how various scholars have defined populism (a highly contested term), major events in the term's intellectual history, and key populist movements around the world. More broadly, I learned about what defines a democracy, what motivates people to get involved in social movements, and how political change happens.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Paris is brilliant. The discussion flowed naturally and Paris would always help us think more broadly about our ideas. 
Weakness: I honestly can't think of anything, I think this class was amazing.

Reading is consistently interesting and not too many pages. Essays aren't too much work and allow you to explore topics you're interested in. Paris is usually a very good discussion leader - he manages to keep a good discussion going without feeling overly structured. That being said, some classes end up being more lecture-y or run out of things to say before the end.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It was a great class and Paris is the best. His feedback for writing papers, in addition to being a brilliant professor, show why this class is a great class!!
Yes! It's an interesting seminar on a valuable topic without too much work. Paris sometimes opines a little more than I'd have liked, but he is an engaging and supportive professor.
